page.title: 15Holy Trinity Church
page.content: The church was built in 1840 and the tower, stained glass windows, electric light, choir stalls and a pipe organ have been added since. The church is listed as a building of Historic and Architectural Interest, Grade 2, and no alterations may be made without special permission from the Diocesan Committee. The present vicar, Father Gordon Bond, has 2 jobs - 1 - Parish priest for Lower Beeding 2 - Domestic Chaplain to the Bishop of Horsham. Pattern of worship - 2nd, 4th & 5th Sundays - 8.00 - Holy Communion at Holy Trinity 1st & 3rd Sundays - 8.30 - Holy Communion at St. John's, Coolhurst (a small church also in parish)
